intro: Ilex bidoupensis, commonly known as the Bidoup Pine, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to the mountainous regions of southern Vietnam. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Ilex bidoupensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats at higher elevations, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
